channel.title: World War I
channel.description:
I need to know what these people had to do with WWI?
[u]List of people[/u] 1)David Lloyd George 2)[s]Franz Josef[/s] 3)Czar Nicholas II 4)Georges Clemenceau 5)Woodrow Wilson 6)Wilhelm II
I would like to know how where these people involved in WWI. I researched on these people for some long time now and I can't find how they were involved. I did find some info but not the info that I'm looking for.

item.title: World War I
item.dc:creator: @kilermage3 kilermage3
item.description:
@kilermage3 wrote:

[quote=“omgh4x0rz, post:7, topic:78335”]Czar Nicholas II was the “king” (actually he was a czar…) of Russia during WWI. He mobilized Russia to protect Serbia against Austria-Hungry, which meant the Germans had to aid the A-H, so then Britain and France were committed to help Russia. This is called an “entangling alliance”.
You seen the movie Anastasia? Nicholas II was her dad and got executed.

Wilhelm II was the leader of Germany… not much to say about him, other than he was an idiot.

Woodrow Wilson was the US president. Tried to avoid entering the war for a long time. After the war he came up with the idea for the League of Nations, but it was rejected by Congress. However, Britain and France among others both joined. It soon collapsed without the US. It was the precursor to the UN[/quote]

This help a little more because I already knew some of this. Thank you.

[quote=“badboiz95, post:8, topic:78335”]David Lloyd George (1863-1945), invariably considered the quintessential Welshman, was in fact born in Manchester on 17 January 1863, the son of a schoolmaster.

After his father died a year following David’s birth, his mother took her two children to live with her brother, Richard, in Llanystumdwy, Caernarvonshire.

An intelligent child, Lloyd George performed well at school, leaving to train as a solicitor, and was articled by the Law Society in January 1879. Upon completion of his training Lloyd George established his own practice in Criccieth, developing a reputation as a lawyer who was willing to defend people against authority.

Lloyd George married in 1888, to Margaret Owen, the daughter of a wealthy farmer. A non-conformist, he worshipped at the Disciples of Christ Chapel in Criccieth, where he honed his skills as an orator.

your welcome[/quote]

Thank you very much for this info on WWI.

Read full topic

Seven words: G-O-O-G-l-E!
GOOGLE! GOOGLE! Google! Wikipedia!!!
MSN! DOGPILE.COM!!!

Read full topic

item.title: World War I
item.dc:creator: @badboiz95 badboiz95
item.description:
@badboiz95 wrote:

David Lloyd George (1863-1945), invariably considered the quintessential Welshman, was in fact born in Manchester on 17 January 1863, the son of a schoolmaster.

After his father died a year following David’s birth, his mother took her two children to live with her brother, Richard, in Llanystumdwy, Caernarvonshire.

An intelligent child, Lloyd George performed well at school, leaving to train as a solicitor, and was articled by the Law Society in January 1879. Upon completion of his training Lloyd George established his own practice in Criccieth, developing a reputation as a lawyer who was willing to defend people against authority.

Lloyd George married in 1888, to Margaret Owen, the daughter of a wealthy farmer. A non-conformist, he worshipped at the Disciples of Christ Chapel in Criccieth, where he honed his skills as an orator.

your welcome

Read full topic

item.title: World War I
item.dc:creator: @omgh4x0rz omgh4x0rz
item.description:
@omgh4x0rz wrote:

Czar Nicholas II was the “king” (actually he was a czar…) of Russia during WWI. He mobilized Russia to protect Serbia against Austria-Hungry, which meant the Germans had to aid the A-H, so then Britain and France were committed to help Russia. This is called an “entangling alliance”.
You seen the movie Anastasia? Nicholas II was her dad and got executed.

Wilhelm II was the leader of Germany… not much to say about him, other than he was an idiot.

Woodrow Wilson was the US president. Tried to avoid entering the war for a long time. After the war he came up with the idea for the League of Nations, but it was rejected by Congress. However, Britain and France among others both joined. It soon collapsed without the US. It was the precursor to the UN

item.title: World War I
item.dc:creator: @kilermage3 kilermage3
item.description:
@kilermage3 wrote:

There the list of people has been updated. Hope some of you can help me.

[quote=“Dboi, post:4, topic:78335”]I know you don’t like WikiPedia but there’s a good one here

en.wikipedia.org

Franz Joseph I of Austria

Franz Joseph I or Francis Joseph I (Franz Joseph Karl; 18 August 1830 – 21 November 1916) was Emperor of Austria along with his wife: Empress Elizabeth of Austria, Queen of Hungary. He was also King of Hungary, King of Bohemia, and monarch of many other states of the Austro-Hungarian Empire, from 2 December 1848 to his death. From 1 May 1850 to 24 August 1866 he was also President of the German Confederation. He was the longest-reigning Emperor of Austria and King of Hungary, as well as the th

It’s all I can find on Franz Josef and World War I[/quote]

Thank you for this, even though I don’t like wikipeidia but w/e, as long as I get a good grade on this then I’m happy.

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:5, topic:78335”][quote author=kilermage3 link=topic=115018.msg1138176#msg1138176 date=1176322135]
I don’t like wikipeidia because at the top it has a “edit” botton, so then this means it could be false information, which I don’t want to take from there. The “edit” in wikipeidia is bad because anyone can click on it and edit and whatever they like in there.
[/quote]

They have many many moderators what watch all the edits, so most of the information there is correct.

Answers from this forum won’t be any more correct than ones you get from wikipedia anyway.

As far as I can tell, Franz Josef was Archduke Franz Ferdinand’s uncle, and the archduke’s assassination was the reason WWI started.[/quote]

Thanky you cause now I know why he actually started the war, because my teacher said that he had started the war, but he didnt tell me why he did.

Read full topic

item.title: World War I
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

kilermage3:

I don’t like wikipeidia because at the top it has a “edit” botton, so then this means it could be false information, which I don’t want to take from there. The “edit” in wikipeidia is bad because anyone can click on it and edit and whatever they like in there.

They have many many moderators what watch all the edits, so most of the information there is correct.

Answers from this forum won’t be any more correct than ones you get from wikipedia anyway.

As far as I can tell, Franz Josef was Archduke Franz Ferdinand’s uncle, and the archduke’s assassination was the reason WWI started.

Read full topic
